artist: Decorator: George Wolliscraft Rhead; Manufacturer: Wedgwood; Retailer: Richard Briggs
creditline: Gift of Samuel D. and Patricia N. McCullough in honor of Christopher Monkhouse
description: spouted, handled vessel with wide mouth and short neck; one side decorated with portrait of Longfellow; opposite side has portion of poem; neck decorated with flowers and ribbons with names of Longfellow works
inscription:
Inscription and stamp
On bottom, in black: [Manufactured by Josiah Wedgwood and Sons Etruria/ for/ Richard Briggs/ Boston/ Registerd in Great Britain and France/ also in the/ United States]
markings: On bottom, in red: [F920/16]; on bottom, stamped: [WEDGWOOD]
text: “Longfellow” jugs were made by Wedgwood, the famous English manufacturer of fine china and porcelain, as a tribute to the American poet Henry Wadsworth Longfellow. On one side is the poet’s portrait; on the other, the first lines of his long poem Kéramos. The jugs were commissioned by Richard Briggs, a Boston retailer of china and glass. Briggs gave one to Longfellow at Christmastime in 1880 and received the poet’s thanks in a letter dated December 30.
title: "Longfellow jug"
